info.title: EVE Frontier Dev Tools API
info.description:
API for navigation and character information data retrieval.

This API provides optimized navigation tools, character and corporation data lookups, and MUD Explorer table access for the EVE Frontier universe.

**Features include:**
- Optimal Stargate network planning and deployment tools
- Fuzzy-matched system route calculations with NPC gate avoidance
- Real-time smart character and structure data lookup
- MUD table querying and data inspection

For detailed docs and examples, expand the endpoints below.

Some of the data is cached and/or modified behind the scenes to make more useful outputs for various uses. 

**How to Use:**
- **Devs:** Should be straightforward to plug in to your services
- **Non-Devs:** You can still use this page. Expand a **GET** service, on the right, click the **Try it out** button which will allow you to enter parameters or run with the default. Click **Execute**. Slightly below in the **Responses** section, you will get an output in the **Code 200** **Successful Response** area. All defaults are functional.

**Intent/Summary:**
- Normalize a core set of navigation functionality to allow app builders to integrate endpoints instead of 50 versions of optimization tools
- Character tools/MUD tools were used as helpers to diagnose character issues, identify Corp IDs easier and generally troubleshooting
- Derive feedback on usefullness of trying to set a standard
    - If there is adoption, will push this to an open-source repo for community-driven development
- Backend is Python/Docker
- Deployed via CloudRun -- you could experience a slight pause when hitting the service if it has been some time since last active while it spins up.

**Contact:**
Please contact **Zlake** with any issues, suggestions or feedback.

**TODO**
- Clean Repo and push to public
- Add dynamic fuel pricing or arguments for fuel pricing to optimization algo
- Add player controlled SmartGates and canJump logic to routing
- Provide endpoints for data used on the backend such as mass, volume, typeIds for InGame Assets
- Further refine/speedup Navigation tools
- Once available, add in market endpoints
- Likely move to registering users and providing API keys to secure and manage access

get.summary: Determine the Optimal StarGate Network Placement
get.description:
### Find the shortest route while avoiding or deprioritizing NPC-gated systems. Uses fuzzy matching to return a 404 if your names are invalid with suggestions to fix.

**Query Parameters:**
- **start_name** (*str*, default: ICT-SVL): Name of the starting system.
- **end_name** (*str*, default: UB3-3QJ): Name of the destination system.
- **max_distance** (*float*, default: 499): Maximum distance (ly) between two systems in the route.
- **npc_avoidance_level** (*int*, default: 3): 0 (off) to 3 (strict avoidance).

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the optimized route.

**Example Request:**
```
https://api.frontierdevtools.com//optimal_stargate_network_and_deployment?start_name=ICT-SVL&end_name=UB3-3QJ&max_stargate_distance=499&npc_avoidance_level=3&include_ships=Flegel&avoid_gates=false
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
"route": [
    {
    "from": "ICT-SVL",
    "to": "I.PJR.0N1",
    "distance_ly": "391"
    },
    {
    "from": "I.PJR.0N1",
    "to": "H.L3N.5XY",
    "distance_ly": "278"
    },
    {
    "from": "H.L3N.5XY",
    "to": "E9H-LGK",
    "distance_ly": "433"
    },
    {
    "from": "E9H-LGK",
    "to": "UB3-3QJ",
    "distance_ly": "359"
    }
]
}
```

get.summary: Find the shortest travel route between two systems
get.description:
### Find the shortest route between two systems.

**Query Parameters:**
- **start_name** (*str*, default: ICT-SVL): Name of the starting system.
- **end_name** (*str*, default: UB3-3QJ): Name of the destination system.
- **avoid_gates** (*bool*, default: False): Whether to avoid (True) NPC Gates or not (False)
- **max_distance** (*float*, default: 100): Maximum distance (ly) between two systems in the route.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the optimized route.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /find_route?start_name=ICT-SVL&end_name=UB3-3QJ&max_distance=120
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "route": [
        {
            "from": "ICT-SVL",
            "to": "R.Y9N.D51",
            "distance_ly": "495"
        },
        {
            "from": "R.Y9N.D51",
            "to": "D.GHQ-89",
            "distance_ly": "320"
        }
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Evaluate Optimal Gate Deployment for Selected Ships
get.description:
### Simulate gate deployment strategies across a stargate-optimized route for a selection of ships.

**Query Parameters:**
- **start_name** (*str*, default: ICT-SVL): Starting solar system name.
- **end_name** (*str*, default: UB3-3QJ): Destination solar system name.
- **max_stargate_distance** (*float*, default: 499): Max LY distance between Star Gates.
- **npc_avoidance_level** (*int*, default: 3): 0 (off) to 3 (strict): avoid NPC-gated systems.
- **include_ships** (*str*, default: Flegel): Ship name to evaluate for deployment.
- **avoid_gates** (*bool*, default: False): Whether to avoid (True) NPC Gates or not (False)

**Returns:**
- JSON list of optimal gate deployment strategies for the selected ships, sorted by performance.

get.summary: Find the distance between two systems
get.description:
### Calculate the distance in light-years between two solar systems.

**Query Parameters:**
- **system_a** (*str*, default: EFN-12M): First system name.
- **system_b** (*str*, default: H.BQL.581): Second system name.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the validated system names and the calculated distance in light-years.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /calculate_distance?system_a=EFN-12M&system_b=H.BQL.581
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "system_a": "EFN-12M",
    "system_b": "H.BQL.581",
    "distance_ly": "294.62"
}
```

get.summary: Find all systems within a specified distance
get.description:
### Return all systems within a specified max distance from a reference system.


**Query Parameters:**
- **system_name** (*str*, default: EFN-12M): The reference system to search around.
- **max_distance** (*float*, default: 60): Maximum distance (in light-years).

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with a list of nearby systems and their distances from the reference system.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /find_systems_within_distance?system_name=EFN-12M&max_distance=60
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "reference_system": "EFN-12M",
    "nearby_systems": [
        {
            "system_name": "OCL-D3M",
            "distance_ly": "58"
        },
        {
            "system_name": "OKN-N3M",
            "distance_ly": "59"
        }
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Find common systems within a specified distance of two systems
get.description:
### Find systems that are within a given distance from *both* input systems.

System names are validated independently. This is useful to identify a common jump point or stargate location between two systems.

**Query Parameters:**
- **system_a** (*str*, default: E9H-LGK): First reference system.
- **system_b** (*str*, default: IMK-85H): Second reference system.
- **max_distance** (*float*, default: 400): Maximum distance from each system.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with shared nearby systems and their distances from each reference point.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /find_common_systems_within_distance?system_a=E9H-LGK&system_b=IMK-85H&max_distance=400
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "reference_systems": ["E9H-LGK", "IMK-85H"],
    "common_systems": [
        {
            "system_name": "IT0-7MJ",
            "distance_from_a_ly": "360",
            "distance_from_b_ly": "368"
        },
        {
            "system_name": "IMQ-VKJ",
            "distance_from_a_ly": "392",
            "distance_from_b_ly": "318"
        }
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Calculate the maximum travel distance for a ship
get.description:
### Find the jump range of a ship.

**Query Parameters:**
- **current_fuel** (*float*): Amount of fuel in your tank.
- **fuel_efficiency** (*float*): Fuel efficiency as a whole number (e.g., 80% = 80).
- **mass** (*float*): Mass in kg from the "show info" window when fully loaded to jump.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the max travel distance.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /calculate_travel_distance?current_fuel=2800&fuel_efficiency=80&mass=4795000
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "max_travel_distance_ly": "125.83"
}
```

get.summary: Calculate fuel required to travel a given distance
get.description:
### Find the fuel needed to travel a specific distance.

**Query Parameters:**
- **mass** (*float*): Mass in kg from the "show info" window when fully loaded.
- **lightyears** (*float*): Distance to travel in light-years.
- **fuel_efficiency** (*float*): Fuel efficiency (e.g., 80 = 80%).

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the fuel required.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /calculate_fuel_required?mass=4795000&lightyears=420&fuel_efficiency=80
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "fuel_required": "2514.38"
}
```

get.summary: Calculate how much fuel is used per light-year
get.description:
### Find how much fuel your ship uses per light-year of travel.

**Query Parameters:**
- **mass** (*float*): Mass of the ship in kg.
- **fuel_efficiency** (*float*): Fuel efficiency (e.g., 80 = 80%).

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with fuel used per light-year.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /calculate_fuel_per_lightyear?mass=4795000&fuel_efficiency=80
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "fuel_per_lightyear": "0.60"
}
```

get.summary: Find public information about a character by name
get.description:
### Find public information about a character given their in-game name.

**Query Parameters:**
- **player_name** (*str*): Case-sensitive name of a player.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the public information about that player, ensuring all values are serialized as plain strings.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_character_by_name?player_name=Zlake
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "characters": [
        {
            "address": "0xf5f889892848a5344838b281101b1553a4837316",
            "id": "6425463909252110460469638684213996014816210684576621181392451609492115685376",
            "corpId": "98000003",
            "name": "Zlake",
            "isSmartCharacter": "True",
            "createdAt": "0",
            "eveBalanceWei": "1010000000000000000",
            "gasBalanceWei": "864136049501080"
        }
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Find public information about a character by wallet address
get.description:
### Find public information about a character given their wallet address.

**Query Parameters:**
- **player_address** (*str*): Wallet address of the player.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with the public information about that player, ensuring all values are serialized as plain strings.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_character_by_address?player_address=0xf5f889892848a5344838b281101b1553a4837316
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "characters": [
        {
            "address": "0x....",
            "id": "6425463909252110460469638684213996014816210684576621181392451609492115685376",
            "corpId": "98000003",
            "name": "Zlake",
            "isSmartCharacter": "true",
            "createdAt": "0",
            "eveBalanceWei": "1010000000000000000",
            "gasBalanceWei": "864136049501080"
        }
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Find all characters in a corporation given a corp ID
get.description:
### Find all characters in a corporation given a corp ID.

**Query Parameters:**
- **corp_id** (*str*): Corporation ID, either pulled from a character or in-game info.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with all characters in the corporation identified by `corp_id`.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_chars_by_corp_id?corp_id=98000003
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "corp_id": "98000003",
    "corp_characters": [
        "Char1",
        "Char2",
        "Char3"
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Find all characters in a corporation given a playerâ€™s name
get.description:
### Find all characters in a corporation given another player's name.

**Query Parameters:**
- **player_name** (*str*): Case-sensitive in-game character name.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object with a list of all characters in the same corporation as `player_name`.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_chars_by_player?player_name=input_char_name
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "player_name": "input_char_name",
    "corp_characters": [
        "Char1",
        "Char2",
        "Char3"
    ]
}
```

get.summary: Find the gate network for a given player name or corp ID
get.description:
### Find the gate network for a given player name or corp ID. *This data is cached and not regularly updated*

**Query Parameters:**
- **identifier** (*str*): Case-sensitive in-game character name or corpID

**Returns:**
- A JSON object of the current gate network or a restricted message.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_gate_network?identifier=98000004
```

**Example Response (Valid Data):**
```json
{
    "gate_network": [
        {
            "from_system": "ELM-D0J",
            "to_system": "null",
            "owner": "MicroKong",
            "fuel_amount": "500",
            "fromIsOnline": "False",
            "toIsOnline": "null"
        },
        {
            "from_system": "E6H-RVH",
            "to_system": "EQM-42J",
            "owner": "MicroKong",
            "fuel_amount": "344",
            "fromIsOnline": "False",
            "toIsOnline": "False"
        }
    ]
}
```

**Example Response (Restricted ID):**
```json
{
    "detail": "Unable to return REAP Data"
}
```

Retrieves data from a specified MUD table.

**Query Parameters:**
- **tablename** (*str*): The name of the table to query.
- **limit** (*int*, optional): The maximum number of records to retrieve. If not provided, all records are returned.
- **filter_value** (*str*, optional): A filter condition applied to the first key column in the table.

**Returns:**
- A JSON object containing:
    - **"table"** (*str*): The name of the queried table.
    - **"columns"** (*list* of *str*): A list of column names from the table.
    - **"data"** (*list* of *dict*): A list of dictionaries where each dictionary represents a row, with keys as column names and values as row values.

**Example Request:**
```
GET /get_mud_table_data?tablename=CharactersTable&limit=2
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
"table": "CharactersTable",
"columns": [
    "characterId",
    "characterAddress",
    "corpId",
    "createdAt"
],
"data": [
    {
    "characterId": "98871062387115037444364141419090065812481202731919592000305631490714909180",
    "characterAddress": "0x7e48f47b877227ffc3d5396f516044e79aef77f8",
    "corpId": "98000005",
    "createdAt": "1741328834"
    },
    {
    "characterId": "130819829625681100337969536607612248115466983599341682913106800954885202891",
    "characterAddress": "0x96c606aa9276f799617a240b306c04644dbff405",
    "corpId": "98000011",
    "createdAt": "1741291492"
    }
]
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `400 Bad Request`: If the table name is invalid or not found.
- `500 Internal Server Error`: If an unexpected error occurs during query execution.

**Raises:**
- `HTTPException`: If the requested table does not exist or an error occurs while fetching data.

tags.name: Optimization Tools
tags.description: Tools for optimizing StarGate Network Deployment, including fuel cost, range calculation, and deployment strategies for specific ship types.

tags.name: Navigation Tools
tags.description: Tools for finding routes, system distances and jump ranges.

tags.name: Character Tools
tags.description: APIs for retrieving character and corporation information. Builds on CCPs API and some data munging to make more useful outputs.

tags.name: MUD Tools
tags.description: APIs for retrieving information from MUD Explorer tables. Wraps some calls to Observe MUD Explorer for easier use and a single functional endpoint.
